result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Cunningham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing March 17, 2017.
*March 17, 2017  Awarded to Michael C. in the amount of $3,850.00.  Joint and several with coactor in 15CF1029.  DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during period of Extended Supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by DOC.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of Extended Supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two and case 15CF862.  Credit for 736 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one and case 15CF862.  Credit for 736 days.

records.addlTxt: Amended per restitution ordered.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim, Michael C., appears by telephone.  Restitution hearing held.  Parties question victim as to amounts being requested.  Court hears argument.  For reasons as set forth, Court orders restitution awarded to Michael C. in the amount of $3850.00, joint and several with co-actor in 15CF1029.  As to payment of restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Filed, Restitution Worksheet with attachments.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathan Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim (Michael C.) appears by video conferencing.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS (CONCURRENT to COUNT 2 and CASE #15CF862), with credit for 736 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS (CONCURRENT to COUNT 1 and CASE #15CF862), with credit for 736 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

As to restitution, Court orders matter scheduled for restitution hearing.  Victim to appear by video conferencing on next date.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 11:00 am. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Same appearances.  Trial continues.  Closing arguments by the defense and rebuttal by the state.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:12pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Walls and Beal who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Court places juror questions on the record.  At the hour of 4:40pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to both counts which was then read.  As to question on COUNT 2, juror answered "YES."  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court orders defendant REMANDED.  Defendant has other pending matters set for jury trial.  Court sets this matter for status conference on 2/25/16 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness Melvin D. in court with Attorney Mary Garvin-Guimont.  Witness Melvin D. in custody.  Witness advises the Court that he is asserting his 5th amendment rights and will NOT be testifying in this case.   Jury in box at 9:30am.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Detective Daniel Knitter, MPD Detective Michael Tanem.  Jury out of box.   State rests.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Jury in the box.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing argument by state.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour.  Trial to resume at 1:15pm.

Court places trial rulings on the record.  Jury in box.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn testimony of Mike C. continues.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Joel Susler, MPD Detective Brant Ungerer, MPD Detective Britt Kohnert, MPD Officer Adam Isleb, MPD Officer Ryan DeWitt, State recalls MPD Officer Joel Susler.  Exhibits 7-10 received.  Jury out of box at 4:48pm.  Court places sidebars on the record.  Trial to continue on 1/21/16 at 9:00am in Br. 35.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears argument re: defense objection to jury panel. For reasons as stated on the record, Court finds burden required by defense has not been met, trial to continue with current jury panel.  Court preserves record.  Jury panel in court at 9:32am.  Voir dire continues.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Mike C.  Exhibits 1-6 received.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour, trial to continue at 1:30pm.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appears for witness, Melvin D. who appears in person, in custody.  Witness has two cases before Judge Cimpl (15CF1029 & 14CF2064) currently scheduled for sentencing.  Witness states he wishes to testify in this case against the advice of counsel.  Attorney Garvin Guimont seeks to withdraw, Attorney Guimont to seek emergency appointment of counsel by OPD.  Counsel to appear tomorrow along with new attorney.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:37pm.  Panel released at 4:49pm.  Court places sidebars on the record.  Jury selection to continue on 1/21/16 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter is called on the record.  State is ready to proceed.  Defense motion to adjourn trial date argued and denied by the Court.  Court contacts Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont re: potential witness testimony.  Attorney Guimont appears in Court, Court holds additional conference in chambers with counsel.  Attorney Guimont advises the Court that her client does not wish to testify, counsel to speak to her client over the lunch hour and report back to the Court.  Court stands in recess for the lunch hour, jury selection to proceed at 2:00pm.

Defendant Timothy Cunningham in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Timothy Cunningham in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has 15CF416, 15CF962, 15CF965 scheduled for SPEEDY trial today (EXPIRES: 1/20/16).  Court holds final pretrial conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter is called on the record.  Court places status of all matters on the record.  State is not able to proceed to trial on case 15CF862 or 15CF416.  Court determines that cases are unable to proceed due to issues caused by the State.  Defense motion to reduce bail to signature bond on those cases is GRANTED by the Court.  Court to set terms and conditions of bond as to those cases tomorrow.  State is able to proceed to trial in 15CF965.  Defense counsel's motion to adjourn trial (as to 15CF965 only) to tomorrow argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
